label: Democratic South
description: Lincoln carried 0 of 11 seceding states. The South voted for pro-slavery candidates (Breckinridge, Bell).

label: Solid South holds
description: Hoover carried 0 of 11. Despite the Depression, the Democratic South remained unbroken.

label: Dixiecrat revolt
description: Dewey carried 0 of 11. Thurmond's Dixiecrat campaign won 4 states, showing the South would break, but not yet for the GOP.

quotes.text: We stand for the segregation of the races and the racial integrity of each race.
All the laws of Washington and all the bayonets of the Army cannot force the Negro into our homes, our schools, our churches.

label: Goldwater vs. Civil Rights Act
description: Goldwater carried 5 of 11 (AL, GA, LA, MS, SC) after opposing the Civil Rights Act, the first mass Deep South breakthrough since Reconstruction.

quotes.text: The Democratic Party has abandoned the people. It has repudiated the Constitution of the United States.
quotes.source: Strom Thurmond, switching to GOP, September 1964

quotes.text: Goldwater won 87% of the vote in Mississippi, the highest percentage in the nation.
Extremism in the defense of liberty is no vice.

label: Reagan coalition
description: Reagan carried 10 of 11 (Carter won home-state Georgia). The Southern Strategy reaches full effect.

quotes.source: Ronald Reagan, Neshoba County Fair, Mississippi, 1980

quotes.text: The more Negroes who register as Democrats in the South, the sooner the Negrophobe whites will quit the Democrats and become Republicans.
You start out in 1954 by saying 'n----r, n----r, n----r.' By 1968 you can't say that... So you say stuff like forced busing, states' rights.

label: GOP sweep
description: Bush carried 11 of 11, completing the realignment. The party of Lincoln now holds the former Confederacy.

label: Ten of eleven states
description: GOP carried 10 of 11. Virginia's demographic shift makes it the lone holdout as the rest remain solidly Republican.
